title: US-China trade deal hopes lift Wall Street
text:
New York | US stocks have gained on hopes that top-level US-China trade talks would yield at least a partial deal.

Wall Street's main indexes moved higher after US President Donald Trump tweeted he would meet Chinese Vice Premier Liu He on Friday for further trade talks.

Robert Pavlik, chief investment strategist at SlateStone Wealth in New York, said the announcement had given investors hope for an agreement.

"The tweet ... is giving market participants a reason to believe that perhaps a trade deal or at least a partial trade deal might be announced as early as tomorrow," he said.

Separately, Mr Liu said Beijing was willing to reach an agreement with Washington to prevent any further escalation in the trade war, Chinese state news agency Xinhua reported.
description: Donald Trump tweeted he would meet Chinese Vice Premier Liu He for further trade talks, raising hopes of at least a partial deal between the two countries.
